sect1.title: Subgraph
sect1.para: The Subgraph Filter allows users to select root concept(s) in the network along with the types of concepts and relations they wish to view from the root concept(s). Users can select one or several root concept(s) from the filter's top window. Alternatively, they can select concept(s) from the visualisation window before starting the Subgraph Filter from the Tools menu (they will be automatically selected in the list shown in the filter's top window).
The picked concept from the visualisation window is selected in the Subgraph Filter.

From the presented meta-graph, users can choose which types of concepts and relations they wish to view. Press shift and select concept classes and relation types using the mouse. Selected items are highlighted in yellow. After applying the subgraph filter:

Ticking the "non-redundant meta data selection" option before applying the filter will show the actual path that was selected only. For example, this means going from disease concept (in yellow) to the linked interactions (in blue) to some proteins (in red) and stopping there. Going from these proteins back to interactions and so on is considered "redundant".
